info.title: M2M Customer API REST Service

get.description:
Description

This call gets a list of links for further actions of version 1.

Description

This call answers with the list of all assigned customers and subunits.

400.description: Validation error. Refer to the list in the description.

get.summary: Get all allocated Customers from a specific User ID

get.description:
Description

This call retrieves the numbers of SIM cards in specific states, and also link(s) to the SIM List resource containing the proper filter settings if at least one SIM card is in the corresponding state.

Possible validation errors

  • Service unavailable: Maintenance mode activated.
  • Request usage: Too Many Concurrent Requests on Platform.
  • Partner ID: Invalid partner ID.
  • Partner ID: User not authorized for this partner.

400.description: Validation error. Refer to the list in the description.

get.description:
Description

This call retrieves a list of all actions of a specific customer, with a default of 10 entries per page.

Possible validation errors

  • Service unavailable: Maintenance mode activated.
  • Partner ID: Invalid partner ID.
  • Partner ID: User not authorized for this partner.
  • Status: The provided status is invalid.
  • Page: Input invalid page number.
  • Page: Exceed the max allowed page number of 10000.
  • Size: Input invalid size number.
  • Size: Exceed the max allowed size number of 100.
  • Date: Invalid parameter names for a date time filter.
  • Date: dateTo is smaller than dateFrom.
  • Date: Incorrect date and time formats.

    • Optional search parameters

    The pattern for every search parameter: "fieldname:value". Additional fields can simply be combined by semicolon ";"

    Example: search=status:Deleted;datefrom:2010-03-28T00:00:00.000Z

    Supported search fields
    • status – available values:
      • New
      • Done
      • Rejected
      • Open
      • Obsolete

    • dateFrom
    • dateTo

parameters.description: Specify the status of the actions to specific customer. Use ':' to specify status' value.
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: The number of the specific page of listed action records to specific customer. Max. up to 10000
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The amount per page of returned action list records to specific customer. Max. up to 100
parameters.name: size

parameters.description: The start date time for query. If no date is provided, the date one week ago will be used. All timestamps must have a Z at the end to mark them as UTC. See below example
parameters.name: dateFrom

parameters.description: The end date time for query. If no date is provided, the current date will be used. All timestamps must have a Z at the end to mark them as UTC. See below example
parameters.name: dateTo

400.description: Validation error. Refer to the list in the description.

get.description:
Description

This call retrieves the current counter value for the API usage of a specific customer.
  • This call itself is NOT considered for the API usage counting.

Possible validation errors

  • Service unavailable: Maintenance mode activated.
  • Partner ID: Invalid partner ID.
  • Partner ID: User not authorized for this partner.

400.description: Validation error. Refer to the list in the description.

get.description:
Description

This call retrieves a list of all pools of the given partnerID.

Possible validation errors

  • Service unavailable: Maintenance mode activated.
  • Partner ID: Invalid partner ID.
  • Partner ID: User not authorized for this partner.

400.description: Validation error. Refer to the list in the description.

get.description:
Description

This call retrieves all SIM cards of a specific customer, with a default of 1000 entries per page. Only the ICCID will be shown, additional fields can be requested.

Possible validation errors

  • Service unavailable: Maintenance mode activated.
  • Partner ID: Invalid partner ID.
  • Partner ID: User not authorized for this partner.

Supported additional fields

Additional fields can simply be combined by semicolon ";"

Example: additionalfields=imsi;imei;status;field1;field2;msisdn;ipaddress

Supported additional fields
  • imsi
  • imei
  • status (refering to logical sim status)
  • msisdn
  • ipaddressconfig
  • field1
  • field2
  • field3
  • field4
  • field5
  • field6
  • field7
  • field8
  • field9
  • field10
  • simaggregateddata

Optional search parameters

The pattern for every search parameter: "fieldname:value". Additional fields can simply be combined by semicolon ";"

Example: search=field1:dadadada;status:Deleted;changedatefrom:2010-03-28T00:00:00.000Z

Supported search fields
  • iccid

  • status – available values:
    • Ordered
    • On Stock
    • Delivered
    • Test
    • Productive
    • Blocked (automatically)
    • Blocked (manually)
    • Suspended
    • Terminated
    • Deleted
    • Undefined
    • Ordered for stock
    • Special Terminated

  • fraudstatus – available values:
    • OK
    • Alarm

  • limitstatus – available values:
    • OK
    • Warning
    • Alarm
    • Suspended

  • field1
  • field2
  • field3
  • field4
  • field5
  • field6
  • field7
  • field8
  • field9
  • field10

  • changedatefrom
  • changedateto

parameters.description: The number of the specific page of listed SIMs to specific customer. Max. up to 10000
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The amount per page of returned SIMs to specific customer. Max. up to 10000
parameters.name: size

parameters.description:
Specify the conditions of the SIMs to specific customer. Use ':' to specify conditional value and ';' to combine multiple fields.
 All timestamps must have a Z at the end to mark them as UTC. e.g. 2022-07-14T00:00:00.000Z
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: Specify what additional data to return within SIMs to specific customer. Use ';' to combine multiple fields.
parameters.name: additionalfields

400.description: Validation error. Refer to the list in the description.

post.description:
Description

This call starts the activation process for one or more (up to 10000) SIM cards.

You find the corresponding profile IDs required for parametrisation in your customer portal GUI (mainly in the menu section settings). The offering ID can be found in your partner data section under My Products.

Example Requests

With additional values 
{
  "iccidParameters": [
    {
      "field1": "TestField1",
      "iccid": "998296987749503",
      "staticIpsPerApnList": [
        {
          "apnName": "testApnName",
          "ipv4AddressList": [
            "testipv4"
          ],
          "ipv6AddressList": [
            "testipv6"
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  ],
  "offeringId": 0,
  "optionIds": [
    0
  ],
  "profileDataParameters": {
    "accessProfileId": 0,
    "barringProfileId": 0,
    "costLimitProfileId": 0,
    "fraudProfileId": 0,
    "limitProfileId": 0
  },
  "startDtRequested": "2022-08-31T02:23:14.902Z",
  "useTestTariff": true
}

Without additional values 
{
  "iccidParameters": [
    {
      "iccid": "8999829698799917213"
    },
    {
      "iccid": "8999829698799917214"
    },
    {
      "iccid": "8999829698799917215"
    }
  ],
  "offeringId": 0,
  "useTestTariff": false
}

With activation template only 
{
  "activationTemplateId": 755338873,
  "iccidParameters": [
    {
      "iccid": "8999829698799917213"
    },
    {
      "iccid": "8999829698799917214"
    },
    {
      "iccid": "8999829698799917215"
    }
  ],
  "useTestTariff": false
}

Possible validation errors

  • Service unavailable: Maintenance mode activated.
  • Request usage: Too Many Concurrent Requests on Platform.
  • Partner ID: Invalid partner ID.
  • Partner ID: User not authorized for this partner.
  • SIM identifier: No identifier provided.
  • SIM identifier: Duplicate identifiers provided.
  • SIM identifier: Mixed identifiers e.a. ICCID and IMSI in one request.
  • SIM identifier: Number of identifiers exceeds the configured max. value.
  • SIM identifier: SIM(s) do not exist for given identifier(s).
  • SIM identifier: SIM(s) for given identifier(s) do not belong to the provided partner ID.
  • SIM status: SIM(s) are currently being processed according to an earlier request (busy state).
  • SIM status: SIM(s) are not in a valid state.
  • Additional Usage/Session Limit: Invalid usage unit provided.
  • Additional Usage/Session Limit: Values must be zero or positive.
  • Open workflow: There is an open workflow for the selected SIM(s).
  • Access: Could not find any access profile with a valid status.
  • Fraud: Could not find any fraud profile with a valid status.
  • Limit: Could not find any limit profile with a valid status.
  • Network: Could not find any network profile with a valid status.
  • Cost limit: Could not find any cost limit profile with a valid status.
  • Offering: Offering is restricted for this SIM action.
  • IP addresses: Some submitted IP-Addresses are already taken.

400.description: Validation error. Refer to the list in the description.

post.description:
Description

This call blocks one or more (up to 10000) SIM cards.

Example Request

{

    },

    },

}

  • Service unavailable: Maintenance mode activated.
  • Request usage: Too Many Concurrent Requests on Platform.
  • Partner ID: Invalid partner ID.
  • Partner ID: User not authorized for this partner.
  • SIM identifier: No identifier provided.
  • SIM identifier: Duplicate identifiers provided.
  • SIM identifier: Mixed identifiers e.a. ICCID and IMSI in one request.
  • SIM identifier: Number of identifiers exceeds the configured max. value.
  • SIM identifier: SIM(s) do not exist for given identifier(s).
  • SIM identifier: SIM(s) for given identifier(s) do not belong to the provided partner ID.
  • SIM status: SIM(s) are currently being processed according to an earlier request (busy state).
  • SIM status: SIM(s) are not in a valid state.
  • Test tariff: SIM(s) cannot be blocked while in test.
  • Open workflow: There is an open workflow for the selected SIM(s).

post.description:
Description

This call starts the order process for new SIM cards of a specific SIM material.

Example Requests

Only mandatory attributes. 
{
  "simType": "canuseeme",
  "numberOfSims": 10,
  "startDtRequested": "2022-10-10",
  "shippingAddress": {
    "companyName": "XZeus",
    "firstName": "John",
    "lastName": "Dao",
    "salutation": "Mr.",
    "street": "FuXing",
    "houseNumber": "5978",
    "postalCode": "987",
    "city": "Taipei",
    "country": "Taiwan"
  }
}

With additional attributes. 
{
  "simType": "canuseeme",
  "numberOfSims": 10,
  "startDtRequested": "2022-10-10",
  "shippingAddress": {
    "companyName": "XZeus",
    "firstName": "John",
    "lastName": "Dao",
    "salutation": "Mr.",
    "street": "FuXing",
    "houseNumber": "5978",
    "postalCode": "987",
    "city": "Taipei",
    "country": "Taiwan",
    "attention": "John Dao",
    "additionToAddress1": "Ally 160",
    "additionToAddress2": "Lane 3",
    "additionalInformation": "thanks"
  },
  "note": "Please send to 2nd floor directly",
  "notificationEmailAddress": "john.dao@xzeus.com",
}

Possible validation errors

  • Service unavailable: Maintenance mode activated.
  • Request usage: Too Many Concurrent Requests on Platform.
  • Partner ID: Invalid partner ID.
  • Partner ID: User not authorized for this partner.
  • Mandatory fields must not be null
  • The size of this field is too large
  • Unable to parse numeric field elements
  • The provided field value is invalid
  • User is not assigned to the customer
  • The provided SIM Type status is not active
  • The provided SIM Type is not related to the customer
  • The given email address is not valid
  • The amount of SIM cards must be a multiple of the package size
  • The ordered amount of SIM cards under cuts the minimum order quantity of minimum number per order of SIM cards
  • The monthly quantity of max allowed number of SIM orders has been exceeded
  • Insufficient number of SIM cards on stock
  • The desired delivery date has to be after the minimal delivery time
  • The preferred delivery date is a holiday
  • The preferred delivery date must not be on a weekend
  • The desired delivery date has to be after the minimal delivery time

400.description: Validation error. Refer to the list in the description.

post.description:
Description

This call sets one or more (up to 10000) SIM cards in productive state.

Example Request

{
  "iccidParameters": [
    {
      "iccid": "998296987749503"
    },
    {
      "iccid": "998296987749504"
    },
    {
      "iccid": "998296987749505"
    },
    {
      "iccid": "998296987749506"
    }
  ]
}

Possible validation errors

  • Service unavailable: Maintenance mode activated.
  • Request usage: Too Many Concurrent Requests on Platform.
  • Partner ID: Invalid partner ID.
  • Partner ID: User not authorized for this partner.
  • SIM identifier: No identifier provided.
  • SIM identifier: Duplicate identifiers provided.
  • SIM identifier: Mixed identifiers e.a. ICCID and IMSI in one request.
  • SIM identifier: Number of identifiers exceeds the configured max. value.
  • SIM identifier: SIM(s) do not exist for given identifier(s).
  • SIM identifier: SIM(s) for given identifier(s) do not belong to the provided partner ID.
  • SIM status: SIM(s) are currently being processed according to an earlier request (busy state).
  • SIM status: SIM(s) are not in a valid SIM or SIM service state. Valid status (techn.) is active (1). Valid status (comm.) is active (1).
  • SIM status: Service connected to one or more SIM cards is not a test tariffs.
  • Open workflow: There is an open 80059 - Set SIM to productive for the selected SIM(s).

post.description:
Description

This call adds, changes or deletes different types of profiles on specific SIM cards.

You find the corresponding profile IDs required for parametrisation in your customer portal GUI (mainly in the menu section settings). Use "delete" instead of a profile ID to remove a profile from SIM cards.

Example Requests

{
  "iccidParameters": [
    {
      "iccid": "998296987749503"
    },
    {
      "iccid": "998296987749504"
    }
  ],
  "profileParameters": {
    "accessProfileId": "755436629",
    "limitProfileId": "delete"
  }
}

Possible validation errors

  • Service unavailable: Maintenance mode activated.
  • Request usage: Too Many Concurrent Requests on Platform.
  • Partner ID: Invalid partner ID.
  • Partner ID: User not authorized for this partner.
  • SIM identifier: No identifier provided.
  • SIM identifier: Duplicate identifiers provided.
  • SIM identifier: Mixed identifiers e.a. ICCID and IMSI in one request.
  • SIM identifier: Number of identifiers exceeds the configured max. value.
  • SIM identifier: SIM(s) do not exist for given identifier(s).
  • SIM identifier: SIM(s) for given identifier(s) do not belong to the provided partner ID.
  • SIM status: SIM(s) are currently being processed according to an earlier request (busy state).
  • SIM status: SIM(s) are not in a valid state.
  • Open workflow: There is an open workflow for the selected SIM(s).
  • Profile: At least one profile must be set.
  • Profile: Profile contains invalid profile id(s).
  • Profile: Invalid limit profile id.

400.description: Validation error. Refer to the list in the description.

This optional call restricts B2B data for selected SIM cards.

  • Partner ID: Invalid partner ID.

  • Open workflow: There is an open 80130 - Change SIM Restriction workflow (in restrict SIM mode) for the selected SIM(s).

post.description:
Description

This call moves specific SIM cards from a customer (superunit) to a corresponding subunit, et vice versa.

Supported SIM states:
  • Delivered SIM cards (inactive SIMs - no service connected to the SIM).
  • Activated SIM cards (service status is 1 (active) or 6 (deactivated).
Point of time when SIM cards are being moved:
  • Instantly -> request contains delivered SIM cards only.
  • Next day -> request contains activated SIM cards only. The target unit does not have a different account (super - and subunit share the invoice).
  • Beginning of next month/next billing period -> request contains activated SIM cards only. The target unit has a different account (super - and subunit do not share the invoice).
Note: in case of a mixed request (delivered + active SIM cards) the execution time is either at the beginning of the next month or on the next day, depending on whether the target unit has own invoicing or not.

Example Requests

{
  "iccidParameters": [
    {
      "iccid": "998296987749503"
    },
    {
      "iccid": "998296987749504"
    }
  ],
  "recipient": 500082
}

Possible validation errors

  • Service unavailable: Maintenance mode activated.
  • Request usage: Too Many Concurrent Requests on Platform.
  • Partner ID: Invalid partner ID.
  • Partner ID: User not authorized for this partner.
  • SIM identifier: No identifier provided.
  • SIM identifier: Duplicate identifiers provided.
  • SIM identifier: Mixed identifiers e.a. ICCID and IMSI in one request.
  • SIM identifier: Number of identifiers exceeds the configured max. value.
  • SIM identifier: SIM(s) do not exist for given identifier(s).
  • SIM identifier: SIM(s) for given identifier(s) do not belong to the provided partner ID.
  • SIM status: SIM(s) are currently being processed according to an earlier request (busy state).
  • SIM status: SIM(s) are not in a valid state.
  • Open workflow: There is an open workflow for the selected SIM(s).
  • Recipient: Recipient is not a valid target.
  • Recipient: Recipient is terminated.
  • Offering: Offering is not valid/blacklisted for the recipient.
  • Option offering: One or more option offerings are not valid/blacklisted for the recipient.
  • Data profile: One or more of the SIMs contain invalid data profiles for the recipient (APNs not allowed, profile not found or invalid customer).

400.description: Validation error. Refer to the list in the description.

get.description:
Description

This call retrieves a list of all SIM transfers of a specific customer.

Possible validation errors

  • Service unavailable: Maintenance mode activated.
  • Partner ID: Invalid partner ID.
  • Partner ID: User not authorized for this partner.
  • Page: Input invalid page number.
  • Page: Exceed the max allowed page number of 10000.
  • Size: Input invalid size number.
  • Size: Exceed the max allowed size number of 50.
  • No SIM Transfer found for the given customer.

parameters.description: The number of the specific page of listed transfers to specific customer. Max. up to 10000
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The amount per page of returned transfers to specific customer. Max. up to 10000
parameters.name: size

parameters.description: Specify the status of the transfers to specific customer
parameters.name: search

400.description: Validation error. Refer to the list in the description.

post.description:
Description

This call starts the transfer process of specific SIM cards from one customer to another one.

Example Requests

With additional values 
{
  "iccidParameters": [
    {
      "iccid": "998296987749503"
    }
  ],
  "recipient": "500384",
  "notePartnerA": "transfer this SIM card",
  "transferRemark01": "true"
}

Without additional values 
{
  "iccidParameters": [
    {
      "iccid": "998296987749503"
    }
  ],
  "recipient": "500384"
}

  • SIM identifier: Number of identifiers exceeds the configured max. value.

  • SIM identifier: SIM(s) for given identifier(s) do not belong to the provided partner ID.

parameters.name: transactionId

parameters.description: The number of the specific page of listed SIMs involved in specific SIM transfer. Max. up to 10000

400.description: Validation error. Refer to the list in the description.

patch.description:
Description

This call updates a specific open SIM transfer – to 'abort' (as sender), or 'accept'/'reject' (as receiver) the transfer.

You find the corresponding profile IDs required for parametrisation in your customer portal GUI (mainly in the menu section settings). The offering ID can be found in your partner data section under My Products.

Example Requests

Update transfer from a sender 
{
  "action": "abort"
}

Update transfer from a receiver 
{
  "action": "accept",
  "transferRemark01": true
}

Possible validation errors

  • Service unavailable: Maintenance mode activated.
  • Request usage: Too Many Concurrent Requests on Platform.
  • Partner ID: Invalid partner ID.
  • Partner ID: User not authorized for this partner.
  • Partner ID: User is assigned to Subunit.
  • Partner ID: No PLS booked for customer with partner ID.
  • Action: The provided action is invalid.
  • Transaction ID: Could not find any transactions with the provided ID.
  • Transaction ID: No active transaction found.
  • Transaction ID: The customer does not match the provided transaction.
  • Access: Could not find any access profile with a valid status.
  • Fraud: Could not find any fraud profile with a valid status.
  • Limit: Could not find any limit profile with a valid status.
  • Network: Could not find any network profile with a valid status.
  • Cost limit: Could not find any cost limit profile with a valid status.
  • Note: Contents of a note exceed the max allowed characters.
  • Remark: Contents of a note exceed the max allowed characters.
  • TransferRemark: Invalid transfer remark, the allowed value is a boolean.
  • As the sending partner, you can only 'abort' the transaction.
  • As the receiving partner, you can only 'accept' or 'reject' the transaction.
  • When choosing the action 'abort', it is not required to add any notes.
  • When choosing the action 'abort', it is not required to set any SIM related properties.
  • When choosing the action 'reject', it is not required to set any SIM related properties.
  • Offering: Offering is restricted for this SIM action.

parameters.description: Transaction ID of the specific transfer
parameters.name: transactionId

400.description: Validation error. Refer to the list in the description.

This optional call unrestricts (allows) B2B data for selected SIM cards.

Example Request

  • SIM identifier: SIM(s) for given identifier(s) do not belong to the provided partner ID.
  • SIM status: SIM(s) are currently being processed according to an earlier request (busy state).
  • SIM status: SIM(s) are not in a valid SIM or SIM service state. Valid status (techn.) is active (1). Valid status (comm.) is active (1).
  • Open workflow: There is an open 80130 - Change SIM Restriction workflow (in unrestrict SIM mode) for the selected SIM(s).
  • Customer: The customer is not allowed to trigger a SIM Unrestriction.
  • Restriction status: One or more SIM(s) are in invalid restricted state. Valid states are Speed-Step-Down (1), DR (2).

This call cancels a specific open action for a SIM card.

Example Requests

  "status": "cancelled"
}

Possible validation errors

  • Service unavailable: Maintenance mode activated.
  • Request usage: Too Many Concurrent Requests on Platform.
  • Partner ID: Invalid partner ID.
  • Partner ID: User not authorized for this partner.
  • Action ID: User's partner ID has no access to requested action ID.
  • Action ID: Invalid action ID.
  • Workflow: Corresponding workflow doesn't exist.
  • Workflow: Corresponding workflow doesn't support cancellation.
  • Workflow: Corresponding workflow is already finished (done).
  • Workflow: Point of no return has been passed. Process cannot be cancelled as of now.

post.description:
Description

This method allows you to check the SIM status directly in the HLR. The request is asynchroneous. You can see the updated data with a call to simDetails.

Possible validation errors

  • Service unavailable: Maintenance mode activated.
  • Request usage: Too Many Concurrent Requests on Platform.
  • Partner ID: Invalid partner ID.
  • Partner ID: User not authorized for this partner.
  • SIM identifier: ICCID does not exist or does not belong to given partner ID.
  • SIM status: SIM is not in a valid SIM or SIM service state. Valid status (techn.) is active (1), termination marked (7), tariff change marked (17), special termination marked (18), option change marked (20), IP based billing operations marked (22).
  • SIM service function: checkSimInHlr is not supported for SIM card.
  • HLR request frequency: Too frequent HLR requests.

400.description: Validation error. Refer to the list in the description.

post.description:

  • Partner ID: Invalid partner ID.
  • Partner ID: User not authorized for this partner.

  • SIM status: SIM is not in a valid SIM or SIM service state. Valid status (techn.) is active (1), termination marked (7), tariff change marked (17), special termination marked (18), option change marked (20), IP based billing operations marked (22).
  • HLR request frequency: Too frequent HLR requests.

parameters.description: The number of the specific page of listed session history records to specific SIM. Max. up to 10000
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The amount per page of returned session history records to specific SIM. Max. up to 50
parameters.name: size

parameters.description: The start date time for query. If no date is provided, the current date will be used. All timestamps must have a Z at the end to mark them as UTC. See below example
parameters.name: dateFrom

parameters.description: The end date time for query. If no date is provided, the date one week ago will be used. All timestamps must have a Z at the end to mark them as UTC. See below example
parameters.name: dateTo

post.description:
Description

Send a message to the SIM card identified by the ICCID.

Possible validation errors

  • Service unavailable: Maintenance mode activated.
  • Request usage: Too Many Concurrent Requests on Platform.
  • Partner ID: Invalid partner ID.
  • Partner ID: User not authorized for this partner.
  • SIM identifier: SIM does not exist for given ICCID.
  • SIM identifier: SIM for given ICCID does not belong to the provided partner ID.
  • SIM status: SIM is not in correct state for sending messages. SIM status (techn.) must be productive (1); Logical SIM status must be test (4) or productive (5).
  • SIM function: SIM is restricted by a service function and cannot send messages.
  • SMS content: Message is too long.

400.description: Validation error. Refer to the list in the description.

message.example: Hello. This is a test SMS.

additionToAddress1.description: Max allowed length of additional address 1 value is 35

additionToAddress2.description: Max allowed length of additional address 2 value is 35

additionalInformation.description: Max allowed length of additional information value is 35

attention.description: Max allowed length of attention value is 100

city.description: Max allowed length of city value is 25

companyName.description: Max allowed length of company name vale is 255

country.description: Max allowed length of country value is 100

firstName.description: Max allowed length of first name value is 40

houseNumber.description: Max allowed length of house number value is 10

lastName.description: Max allowed length of last name value is 40

postalCode.description: Max allowed length of postal code value is 10

salutation.description: Salutation for the receiver. Valid salutation: Mr., Mrs., Company

street.description: Max allowed length of street value is 100

ShippingAddress.description: A address to ship the ordered SIMs

SimActivationParameters.description:
There are several mandatory attributes including activationTemplateId, offeringId, optionIds, startDtRequested, useTestTariff and SIM(ICCID/IMSI/EUICCID) parameter.
All timestamps must have a Z at the end to mark them as UTC. e.g. 2022-07-14T00:00:00.000Z

SimBlockParameter.description: SIM identifier can be ICCID, IMSI or EUICCID. Only one type of identifier allowed per request.

SimCancelParameter.description: Request model has only one attribute which accepts only 'cancelled'

SimChangeTariffParameter.description:
SIM identifier can be ICCID, IMSI or EUICCID. Only one type of identifier allowed per request.
Besides SIM identifier, value for mandatory attribute offeringId must be given.
All timestamps must have a Z at the end to mark them as UTC. e.g. 2022-07-14T00:00:00.000Z

SimEnterPrdouctiveStateParameter.description: SIM identifier can be ICCID, IMSI or EUICCID. Only one type of identifier allowed per request.

SimModifyProfilesParameters.description:
SIM identifier can be ICCID, IMSI or EUICCID. Only one type of identifier allowed per request.
ProfileStringParameters is a mandatory object in the request body.

SimModifyRemarksParameters.description:
SIM identifier can be ICCID, IMSI or EUICCID. Only one type of identifier allowed per request.
Field 1-10 is optional for the target SIM(s).

SimMoveParameters.description:
SIM identifier can be ICCID, IMSI or EUICCID. Only one type of identifier allowed per request.
 Apart from SIM identifier, recipient is also a mandatory attribute in the body.

note.description: Max allowed length of note vale is 4000

notificationEmailAddress.description: Max allowed length of notification email address vale is 100

numberOfSims.description: A number of SIM card(s) to be ordered

simType.description: Max allowed length of sim type vale is 100

startDtRequested.description: A date of the requested start date

SimOrderParameter.description:
There are several mandatory attributes including simType, numberOfSims, startDtRequested.
ShippingAddress is a mandatory object in the request body. Several attributes in object shippingAddress including companyName, firstName, lastName, salutation, street, houseNumber, postalCode, city, country.
* please note: If a preactivated SIM type is provided, an offering attribute MUST be also included.

SimOverrideLimitStatusParameters.description: SIM identifier can be ICCID, IMSI or EUICCID. Only one type of identifier allowed per request.

SimResetFraudStatusParameters.description: SIM identifier can be ICCID, IMSI or EUICCID. Only one type of identifier allowed per request.

SimResetLimitStatusParameters.description: SIM identifier can be ICCID, IMSI or EUICCID. Only one type of identifier allowed per request.

SimRestoreLimitStatusParameters.description: SIM identifier can be ICCID, IMSI or EUICCID. Only one type of identifier allowed per request.

SimRestrictParameter.description: SIM identifier can be ICCID, IMSI or EUICCID. Only one type of identifier allowed per request.

SimSuspendParameters.description: SIM identifier can be ICCID, IMSI or EUICCID. Only one type of identifier allowed per request.

SimTerminationParameters.description:
SIM identifier can be ICCID, IMSI or EUICCID. Only one type of identifier allowed per request.
Besides SIM identifier, attribute specialTermination is also mandatory and has default value 'false'. Set to 'true' if special termination is required.

SimTransferCreationParameters.description:
SIM identifier can be ICCID, IMSI. EUICCID. Only one type of identifier allowed per request.
 Apart from SIM identifier, recipient is also a mandatory attribute in the body.

SimTransferUpdateParameters.description: Action is the only mandatory attribute which accepts only 'abort', 'accept' and 'reject' as value depending on sender or receiver.

SimUnSuspendParameters.description: SIM identifier can be ICCID, IMSI or EUICCID. Only one type of identifier allowed per request.

unit.description: Usage unit of the limit value. Valid units: B, KB, MB, GB

SimUnblockParameter.description: SIM identifier can be ICCID, IMSI or EUICCID. Only one type of identifier allowed per request.

SimUnrestrictParameter.description: SIM identifier can be ICCID, IMSI or EUICCID. Only one type of identifier allowed per request.
